NewWords.WordPhrase: 利用一切机会
死于
n.  spending of money; cost 花费；代价
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It's too much of an expense to own a car.

NewWords.WordPhrase: （对…）有控制力或支配权
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The Australians are in control of the island.

NewWords.WordPhrase: regard as the aim of one's life 将…作为自己的生活目标
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He lived for his work.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. attend or hold social parties 参加（或举办）社交聚会
(pleaded or pled) v. give (sth.) as an excuse or explanation, esp. for doing sth. wrong; make repeated urgent requests (for sth.) 提出…作为借口（或理由）；恳求
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Alice pleaded illness as her reason for being absent.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  more than enough 大量的，许多的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Fish are plentiful in the lake.

NewWords.WordPhrase: (quit or quitted) v. stop; give up (one's job); leave 停止；辞去（工作）；离开
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He quit because the salary was too low.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  反应
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He suffered an allergic reaction to penicillin.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. start (sth.) again; give new energy to 重新开始；使恢复
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. We renewed our discussion after a ten minute break.

NewWords.WordPhrase: try to find or obtain 寻找；设法得到
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Young graduates are seeking after success in life.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n.  一学期；半学年
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She took five courses during the fall semester.

NewWords.WordPhrase: begin (a job, task, etc.) with a particular aim 着手做（某事）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They succeeded in what they set out to do.

NewWords.WordPhrase: take in, absorb 吸收，吸取
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The paper towel will soak up the spilt coffee.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. 搅动，搅和； 激起
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She stirred the sugar into the mixture.

NewWords.WordPhrase: 收回；取回
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I take back what I said.

NewWords.WordPhrase: get honor, praise or approval （因…）获得荣誉（赞誉或认可）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. I can't take all the credit; the others did all the work.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a.  lasting for a short time 暂时的，临时的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The temporary worker was soon replaced by a permanent employee.

NewWords.WordPhrase: make unhappy and worried, etc. 使忧心忡忡
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The bank is being weighed down by a $1.3 billion book of bad debts.
